  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>ILMoE</catalog>
            <entry>ILMoE3319</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Songwriting in the Classroom and Beyond</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Songwriting im Klassenzimmer und jenseits</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Songwriting dans la salle de classe et là-bas</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Songwriting na sala de aula e além</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Songwriting nell'aula e di là</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Songwriting στην τάξη και πέρα</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Songwriting en la sala de clase y más allá</string>
          </title>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="en">In this column,in the ETNI magazine RAG, the writer give advice on classroom songwriting, by introducing the details of two community-based projects in Ireland and Scotland, and giving guidelines to teachers on how to do songwriting in the classroom.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">English</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">music</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">songs</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">writing</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">written expression</string>
          </keyword>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">In dieser Spalte im ETNI Zeitschrift LAPPEN, 
Gemeinschaft-gründete der Verfassergebenrat auf dem Klassenzimmer, 
das songwriting ist, indem er die Details von zwei vorstellte, 
Projekte in Irland und in Schottland, und gebend den Lehrern auf, wie 
Korrekturlinien zu das Songwriting im Klassenzimmer tun Sie.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Dans cette colonne, dans le CHIFFON de magazine 
d'ETNI, le conseil d'élasticité d'auteur sur la salle de classe 
songwriting, en présentant les détails de deux communauté-a basé 
des projets en Irlande et en Ecosse, et donnant des directives aux 
professeurs sur la façon dont à faites songwriting dans la salle de 
classe.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Nesta coluna, no PANO do compartimento de ETNI, o 
conselho da elasticidade do escritor na sala de aula que songwriting, 
introduzindo os detalhes de dois comunidade-baseou projetos em Ireland
e em Scotland, e dando guidelines aos professores em como a faça 
songwriting na sala de aula.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">In questa colonna, nel PANNO dello scomparto di 
ETNI, il consiglio di give del produttore sull'aula che songwriting, 
introducendo i particolari di due Comunità-ha basato i progetti in 
Irlanda ed in Scozia e dando la guida di riferimento agli insegnanti 
su come a faccia songwriting nell'aula.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Σε αυτήν την στήλη, στο ΚΟΥΡΈΛΙ περιοδικών ETNI, ο 
συγγραφέας δίνει τις συμβουλές για τάξεων, με την εισαγωγή των 
λεπτομερειών δύο σε κοινοτικό επίπεδο προγραμμάτων στην Ιρλανδία
και τη Σκωτία, και το δόσιμο των οδηγιών στους δασκάλους για το 
πώς να κάνει στην τάξη.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">En esta columna, en el TRAPO del compartimiento de 
ETNI, el consejo de la elasticidad del programa de escritura sobre la 
sala de clase songwriting, introduciendo los detalles de dos 
comunidad-baso' proyectos en Irlanda y Escocia, y dando guías de 
consulta a los profesores en cómo a haga songwriting en la sala de 
clase.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Englisch</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Musik</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Liede</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Schreiben</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">schriftlicher Ausdruck</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Anglais</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">musique</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">chansons</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">écriture</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">expression écrite</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Inglês</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">música</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">canções</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>

          </keyword>
